description: A five-slide presentation with key information about Basketball.
title: All About Basketball

slides.title: Introduction to Basketball
slides.content: Basketball is a team sport played by two teams of five players each on a rectangular court. The objective is to shoot a ball through a hoop elevated 10 feet above the ground. Points are scored by making field goals (2 points) or three-pointers (3 points), with free throws worth 1 point each.

slides.title: History and Origins
content: Basketball was invented in 1891 by Dr. James Naismith, a Canadian physical education instructor in Springfield, Massachusetts.
Naismith created 13 basic rules and used a soccer ball and two peach baskets as the first hoops.
The first professional league was formed in 1898, but the NBA (National Basketball Association) was established in 1946.
The sport became an Olympic event in 1936 at the Berlin Games, with the United States winning the gold medal.

slides.title: Rules and Gameplay
content: Games consist of four 12-minute quarters in the NBA, with a 15-minute halftime break.
Players advance the ball by bouncing it (dribbling) while walking or running, or by passing it to teammates.
Defensive players can steal the ball, block shots, or force turnovers through various fouls.
The shot clock (24 seconds in NBA) requires teams to attempt a shot within the time limit to prevent stalling.

slides.title: Famous Players and Records
content: Michael Jordan won 6 NBA championships with the Chicago Bulls and is widely considered the greatest basketball player ever.
Kareem Abdul-Jabbar holds the record for most points scored in NBA history with 38,387 points.
Stephen Curry revolutionized the game with his three-point shooting, leading the Golden State Warriors to multiple championships.
Lisa Leslie was the first player to dunk in a WNBA game and won 4 Olympic gold medals with Team USA.

slides.title: Global Impact and Evolution
content: Basketball is played in over 200 countries worldwide, with the NBA being the most popular basketball league globally.
The sport has evolved significantly with rule changes, advanced analytics, and increased athleticism.
International competitions include the FIBA World Cup and Olympic Games basketball tournament.
Basketball culture has influenced fashion, music, and entertainment, with NBA players becoming global icons.
